page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: There is only one means of education in Firle. This is the village school which is attended by 53 pupils from a large geographical area. There are three teachers at the school, one playground attendent and one secrtary. The two cooks come in the morning and go home in the afternoon. School starts at 9.00am and ends at 3.15pm. The average age of school starters is four years old and the leaving age is eleven.The school has two fields.One has a football pitch and a long jump pit the other has a climbing frame. The playground has a netball pitch and hop-scotch.At school lessons include maths, logic ,french, english, P.E., and art.The school has a BBC.B computer, with disc drive, and a video recorder for recording relevent educational programmes.
